revisions.*: Because "rvslots" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used.

{{Taxobox | image = Mycena olida - Lindsey.jpg | image_caption = | image_width = 234px | regnum = [[Fungi]] | divisio = [[Basidiomycota]] | classis = [[Agaricomycetes]] | ordo = [[Agaricales]] | familia = [[Mycenaceae]] | genus = ''[[Mycena]]'' | species = '''''M. olida''''' | binomial = ''Mycena olida'' | binomial_authority = [[Giacomo Bresadola|Bres.]] (1887) | synonyms = ''Hemimycena olida'' (Bres.) [[Rolf Singer|Singer]]
''Marasmiellus olidus'' (Bres.) Singer (1951) }} {{mycomorphbox | name = ''Mycena olida'' | hymeniumType=gills | capShape = conical | whichGills = adnate | stipeCharacter=bare | sporePrintColor=white | ecologicalType=saprotrophic | howEdible=unknown }} '''''Mycena olida''''', commonly known as the '''rancid bonnet''',{{cite web |url=http://www.britmycolsoc.org.uk/library/english-names/ |title=English Names for fungi |work=British Mycological Society website |publisher=British Mycological Society}} is a species of [[mushroom]] in the [[Mycenaceae]] family. It was first described in 1887 by Italian mycologist [[Giacomo Bresadola]].{{cite journal |last= Bresadola G. |year= 1887|title=Fungi tridentini |journal=Fungi tridentini |volume=1 |issue=6–7 |page=73}} ==Description== The [[pileus (mycology)|cap]], initially conical to convex in shape, flattens out with age and typically reaches diameters of up to {{convert|1.5|cm|in|1|abbr=on}}.{{cite web |url=http://home.online.no/~araronse/Mycenakey/olida.htm |title=''Mycena olida'' |work=Key to the Mycenas of Norway |accessdate=2009-09-26 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100525123625/http://home.online.no/~araronse/Mycenakey/olida.htm |archivedate=2010-05-25 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Taxonbar|from=Q6946904}} [[Category:Mycena|olida]] [[Category:Fungi described in 1887]] [[Category:Fungi of Europe]]
